column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Falling
#Text=You ’re on the 236th - level Kaiserstrasse moving sidewalk when you see her .

#Text=You ’re leaning on the railing , waiting to ask Derya about a job , watching the glittering stream of mites that arc over half the sky — flying up to rewind their nanosprings in the stratospheric sunlight , flying down to make Frankfurt run .
#Text=You never get tired of watching them .
#Text=She ’s on the Holbeinsteg bridge .

#Text=Someone ’s hung it up here — a hundred meters of clean gray and green twentieth - century modernism , plucked up from the river Main and suspended in the chilly air 2,360 meters up , between a lump of wooded parkland and a cluster of antique subway cars .

#Text=She ’s wearing a 1950s sundress and a broad - brimmed hat , and it ’s like an essay on the last century — the austere steel bridge , the bright blobs of subway graffiti , and her yellow dress , flapping against her legs as she climbs over the bridge ’s rail .
#Text=A picture of elegance and style from the age of money , violence , and simplicity .
#Text=She ’s a strawberry blonde , slim , her skin blank and virginal as new butter .
#Text=She ’s beyond the rail now , hanging out over the mountain - high drop .
#Text=Thin translucent shadows move across her — the shadows of the neosilk - and - nanotube filaments that hang the city from the hundreds of five - kilometer - high towers that encircle it .
#Text=( A civic agent notices you noticing , and attaches itself to your infospace , whispering statistics —
#Text=“ Each object ’s suspension must weather a class 5 hurricane and the destruction of 80 % of the towers ” —
#Text=“ Frankfurt ’s current population is stable at 53 million ” —
#Text=“ Average age 62 , birth rate 0.22 , net immigration of half a million a year ” —
#Text=“ Current personal squatright : 311 cubic meters per resident ” —
#Text=until you brush it away . )
#Text=You ’re watching her lean out .
#Text=The wind whips her hair , ruffles the skirt around her knees .
#Text=She must be a tourist .
#Text=You remember your first trip to the upper levels : leaning over the edge into the angry swarm of mites , whirring and buzzing warnings and shoving you back like a million mosquito chaperones .
#Text=Everyone tries it once — Except that there are n’t any mites around her .
#Text=You clutch the railing .
#Text=Hot , animal fear surges in your chest .
#Text=She looks up at you and , across the gap of forty meters , smiles a brilliant , heartbreaking smile .
#Text=Then she lets go and falls .
#Text=You scream .
#Text=“ Fucking airsurfers , ” says Derya .

#Text=He steps off the moving sidewalk near you : tall , hook - nosed , the fashionable whorls of pox and acne making constellations of his cheeks and chest ; the glowing , formal tattoos of his committees and lifebrands adorning his massive triceps .
#Text=You swallow on a dry throat .
#Text=Derya , of all people , hearing you scream !
#Text=He gives you a hooded look .
#Text=“ They infect themselves with some designer virus -
#Text=it lets them hack the city ’s person - recognition systems .
#Text=So the mites do n’t see them when they jump .
#Text=Watch — ”
#Text=She ’s swept past the whalelike oval of the public pool on the 202nd , past the sloping mandala of the Google of offices on the 164th .
#Text=At the 131st , below her , is the old Stock Exchange , hung upside - down now as a hipster den .
#Text=Now the mites are finally closing in .
#Text=A silver swarm coalesces around the 164th , and she vanishes into it , like a snip of scallion into cloudy miso soup .
#Text=When the cloud disperses , she ’s standing on one of the Stock Exchange ’s upside - down overhangs .
#Text=She waves , antlike , then crawls through a dormer window .
#Text=“ It ’s not funny , ” Derya says .
#Text=“ They ’re a huge drain on emergency preparedness .
#Text=Ripple effects are causing project slowdowns ... ”
#Text=“ Freeloaders drive systemic evolution , ” you find yourself saying .
#Text=“ Do n’t you quote the founders at me , ” Derya snaps .
#Text=“ The Free Society is fragile .
#Text=The minute enough people find anticontributive behavior cool , the party ’s over —
#Text=it ’s back to capitalist competition or state control . ”
#Text=He stares until you meet his eye .
#Text=“ You even talk to those people -
#Text=are you paying attention ? —
#Text=you even talk to them , your rep will be trashed on all the major servers .
#Text=You wo n’t work , you wo n’t party , you ’ll be defriended by every one of your tribes .
#Text=Got it ? ”
#Text=Her broad - brimmed hat is still sailing on the wind .
#Text=The mites missed it .
#Text=It cuts between the towers of the 50th .
#Text=The upside - down trading floor is deserted .
#Text=There are heaps of yellowed euros and deutschmarks dumped here , like snowdrifts .
#Text=Wood panel , marble .
#Text=Silence .
#Text=And the air is strangely clear .
#Text=You realize : no mites .
#Text=The city has no eyes or ears here .
#Text=You walk through empty , miteless rooms , stepping around light fixtures .
#Text=Then she ’s there , in a doorway .
#Text=Her eyes , bright blue , radiant .
#Text=Her smile , with that chaste yellow dress , so bashful .
#Text=She comes to you .
#Text=“ You want it ? ” she says .
#Text=“ You want to be infected ?
#Text=You want to fly ? ”
#Text=You nod .
#Text=Eyes closing , she leans in for the kiss .

#Text=After hearing Derya rant about an ' airsurfer ' woman that they see jumping off a futuristic bridge in Frankfurt , only to be saved by a cloud of flying mites , a protagonist pursues the woman and accepts her offer to be infected by her kiss with a virus which prevents mites from tracking people .
